cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a framework for optimizing paper-to-reviewer assignments, which involves using suitability scores to measure pairwise affinity between papers and reviewers. This suggests that the paper is likely to fall under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) or machine learning (cs.LG), as these fields often deal with optimization problems and learning algorithms. The paper also mentions the use of integer programming, which is a common technique in information retrieval (cs.IR) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the effectiveness of the matching formulations, which could be relevant to social and information networks (cs.SI).
